div.blockquote: Holly injured her rear on a spiky cactus.

qti-choice-interaction.qti-prompt: Choose whether the bolded part of the sentence is the subject or the predicate.
qti-choice-interaction.qti-simple-choice: subject Correct! "Holly" is the subject because it tells us who is performing the action in the sentence.
predicate Not quite. The predicate contains the verb and describes the action. In this sentence, "injured her rear on a spiky cactus" is the predicate, while "Holly" is the subject.

qti-content-body.p: Correct! "Holly" is the subject of the sentence. The subject tells us who or what is performing the action. The rest of the sentence, "injured her rear on a spiky cactus," is the predicate.

Not quite. Remember that a clause has two main parts: the subject (the main person or thing performing an action) and the predicate (the verb and everything that describes the action). Since the bolded part "Holly" tells us who is performing the action, it's the subject.
